pages.text: Oil is a very valuable resource that can be used for several purposes. It can be found underground, both in small surface pockets from y=40 to y=130, and larger pockets from y=-30 to y=70. Both types of pocket can only be found in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rock.
Crude oil is either $(thing)sweet$() or $(thing)sour$(). Sweet oil is pure and easy to refine further, but sour oil needs to be processed a bit before it can be refined.

The first type of oil that can be found is $(thing)Sour Crude Oil$(). This oil must be $(l:tfc:artisanal/distillation)distilled$() into sweet crude oil before being processed further. This also produces sulfur as a by-product.

Sweet crude oil can then be further distilled into $(thing)kerosene$() and $(thing)bitumen$(). Kerosene can be used as a $(l:tfc:mechanics/lamps)lamp fuel$(), while bitumen can be used as a $(l:tfc:mechanics/charcoal_forge)forge$() fuel in a pinch.
